jishoData.meaning: distract, be mistaken for, go astray, divert

onyomiExamples.meaning: complication, confusion, disorder, chaos, dispute, conflict, trouble, quarrel
artificial pollination, hand pollination, mechanical pollination

kunyomiExamples.meaning: to disappear into, to be lost in, to slip into, to get mixed in among, to do something under the cover of (confusion, etc.), to be almost indistinguishable, to be confusingly similar, to be diverted from (negative emotions, etc.), to forget about, to be distracted by, to be too absorbed in

to divert (e.g. one's mind), to distract, to relieve (boredom, sorrow, etc.), to drown (one's sorrows), to beguile (the time), to conceal (e.g. one's grief with a smile), to hide, to shift (the conversation), to change (the subject)

to divert (e.g. one's mind), to distract, to relieve (boredom, sorrow, etc.), to drown (one's sorrows), to beguile (the time), to conceal (e.g. one's grief with a smile), to hide, to shift (the conversation), to change (the subject)
easily mixed up (e.g. similar words), easily mistaken, confusing, misleading, equivocal, ambiguous
